Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can represent plants growing healthily when they have water and light in their drawing.
The student can illustrate the appearance of plants that do not receive enough water to show they struggle to live or grow.
The student can illustrate the appearance of plants that do not receive enough light to show they struggle to live or grow.
The student can use visual patterns to show the difference in plant health with and without water.
The student can use visual patterns to show the difference in plant health with and without light.
The student can explain through drawings why water and light are necessary for the growth of plants.
